weekday: &#39;short&#39;,\n          year: &#39;numeric&#39;,\n          month: &#39;short&#39;,\n          day: &#39;numeric&#39;,\n          hour: &#39;2-digit&#39;,\n          minute: &#39;2-digit&#39;,\n        }\n        dateElement.textContent = now.toLocaleDateString(&#39;en-US&#39;, options)\n      }\n\n      updateDateTime()\n      setInterval(updateDateTime, 1000)\n\n      // ===== HAMBURGER MENU =====\n      const hamburger = document.getElementById(&#39;hamburger&#39;)\n      const navDropdown = document.getElementById(&#39;navDropdown&#39;)\n\n      hamburger.addEventListener(&#39;click&#39;, () =&gt; {\n        hamburger.classList.toggle(&#39;active&#39;)\n        navDropdown.classList.toggle(&#39;active&#39;)\n      })\n\n      // Close dropdown when clicking outside\n      document.addEventListener(&#39;click&#39;, (e) =&gt; {\n        if (\n          !hamburger.contains(e.target) &amp;&amp;\n          !navDropdown.contains(e.target)\n        ) {\n          hamburger.classList.remove(&#39;active&#39;)\n          navDropdown.classList.remove(&#39;active&#39;)\n        }\n      })\n\n      // Close dropdown when clicking a link\n      navDropdown.querySelectorAll(&#39;.nav-link&#39;).forEach((link) =&gt; {\n        link.addEventListener(&#39;click&#39;, () =&gt; {\n          hamburger.classList.remove(&#39;active&#39;)\n          navDropdown.classList.remove(&#39;active&#39;)\n        })\n      })\n    &lt;/script&gt;\n  &lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n&quot;

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Developing regex-based HTML restructuring script**

I’m planning to write a Python script that uses regex to carefully reformat the HTML service-item blocks while preserving indentation and structure. The script will parse and rebuild each block with proper nested indentation and conditionally include elements like price only when present. I’ll make sure blank lines and spacing mimic the original formatting before running the script.</details></think>

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="bash" data-tool-name="run_terminal_cmd">
<details><summary>Tool use: **command** • Run command: cd /home/tech/projects/ppdb-ts-oct && python - <<'PY'
import re, textwrap, pathlib
path = pathlib.Path('reference/redesign/mockui-service-history.html')
text = path.read_text()
pattern = re.compile(r'(?P<indent>\s*)<div class="service-item">\s*<div class="service-header">\s*(?P<date><div class="service-date">.*?</div>)\s*(?P<price><div class="service-price">.*?</div>)?\s*</div>\s*(?P<details><div class="service-details">.*?</div>)\s*(?P<meta><div class="service-meta">.*?</div>)\s*</div>', re.DOTALL)

def format_block(block: str, indent: str) -> str:
    block = textwrap.dedent(block).strip('\n')
    return '\n'.join(f"{indent}{line}" if line else indent for line in block.splitlines())

def repl(match: re.Match) -> str:
    indent = match.group('indent')
    date = format_block(match.group('date'), indent + '  ')
    details = format_block(match.group('details'), indent + '    ')
    meta = format_block(match.group('meta'), indent + '    ')
    price_block = match.group('price')
    parts = [f"{indent}<div class=\"service-item\">", date, f"{indent}  <div class=\"service-inline\">", details]
    if price_block:
        price = format_block(price_block, indent + '    ')
        parts.append(price)
    parts.append(meta)
    parts.append(f"{indent}  </div>")
    parts.append(f"{indent}</div>")
    return '\n'.join(parts)

new_text, count = pattern.subn(repl, text)
if count == 0:
    raise SystemExit('No matches updated')
path.write_text(new_text + ('\n' if not new_text.endswith('\n') else ''))
print(f'Updated {count} service item blocks')
PY</summary>

```bash
    block = textwrap.dedent(block).strip('\n')
    return '\n'.join(f"{indent}{line}" if line else indent for line in block.splitlines())

    date = format_block(match.group('date'), indent + '  ')
    details = format_block(match.group('details'), indent + '    ')
    meta = format_block(match.group('meta'), indent + '    ')
```

<tool-use data-tool-type="bash" data-tool-name="run_terminal_cmd">
<details><summary>Tool use: **command** • Run command: cd /home/tech/projects/ppdb-ts-oct && python - <<'PY'
from pathlib import Path
import re
path = Path('reference/redesign/mockui-service-history.html')
text = path.read_text()
start = text.find('<div class="service-history">')
if start == -1:
    raise SystemExit('service-history div not found')
idx = start
count = 0
end = None
while idx < len(text):
    if text.startswith('<div', idx):
        count += 1
        idx += 4
        continue
    if text.startswith('</div>', idx):
        count -= 1
        idx += 6
        if count == 0:
            end = idx
            break
        continue
    idx += 1
if end is None:
    raise SystemExit('matching closing div not found')
block = text[start:end]
clean_block = re.sub(r'\n[ \t]*\n+', '\n', block)
if block == clean_block:
    print('No whitespace cleanup needed')
else:
    path.write_text(text[:start] + clean_block + text[end:])
    print('Collapsed blank lines in service history section')
PY</summary>

```bash
from pathlib import Path

            end = idx

    raise SystemExit('matching closing div not found')

if block == clean_block:
    print('No whitespace cleanup needed')
else:
    path.write_text(text[:start] + clean_block + text[end:])
```

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Refining service-item indentation**

I'm figuring out how to consistently reindent the nested HTML blocks within each `service-item`, especially fixing excessive spaces before `<svg>`. My plan is to dedent existing inner contents using `textwrap.dedent` then reapply the intended indentation levels, carefully preserving necessary nested whitespace inside elements like `<svg>`. I'll parse each block with regex, reindent pieces individually, and reconstruct the structure neatly to produce a cleaner, more uniform layout. This approach avoids reverting changes and keeps user modifications intact.</details></think>

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="bash" data-tool-name="run_terminal_cmd">
<details><summary>Tool use: **command** • Run command: cd /home/tech/projects/ppdb-ts-oct && python - <<'PY'
import re, textwrap, pathlib
path = pathlib.Path('reference/redesign/mockui-service-history.html')
text = path.read_text()
pattern = re.compile(r'(?P<indent>\s*)<div class="service-item">\s*(?P<date><div class="service-date">.*?</div>)\s*<div class="service-inline">\s*(?P<details><div class="service-details">.*?</div>)\s*(?P<price><div class="service-price">.*?</div>)?\s*(?P<meta><div class="service-meta">.*?</div>)\s*</div>\s*</div>', re.DOTALL)

def fmt(block: str, indent: str) -> str:
    block = textwrap.dedent(block).strip('\n')
    lines = block.splitlines()
    return '\n'.join(f"{indent}{line.strip()}" for line in lines)

def repl(match: re.Match) -> str:
    indent = match.group('indent')
    date = fmt(match.group('date'), indent + '  ')
    details = fmt(match.group('details'), indent + '    ')
    meta = fmt(match.group('meta'), indent + '    ')
    price_block = match.group('price')
    parts = [f"{indent}<div class=\"service-item\">", date, f"{indent}  <div class=\"service-inline\">", details]
    if price_block:
        price = fmt(price_block, indent + '    ')
        parts.append(price)
    parts.append(meta)
    parts.append(f"{indent}  </div>")
    parts.append(f"{indent}</div>")
    return '\n'.join(parts)

new_text, count = pattern.subn(repl, text)
if count == 0:
    raise SystemExit('No service items matched for reindent')
if not new_text.endswith('\n'):
    new_text += '\n'
path.write_text(new_text)
print(f'Reformatted {count} service items')
PY</summary>

```bash
import re, textwrap, pathlib
path = pathlib.Path('reference/redesign/mockui-service-history.html')
text = path.read_text()
pattern = re.compile(r'(?P<indent>\s*)<div class="service-item">\s*(?P<date><div class="service-date">.*?</div>)\s*<div class="service-inline">\s*(?P<details><div class="service-details">.*?</div>)\s*(?P<price><div class="service-price">.*?</div>)?\s*(?P<meta><div class="service-meta">.*?</div>)\s*</div>\s*</div>', re.DOTALL)

def fmt(block: str, indent: str) -> str:
    block = textwrap.dedent(block).strip('\n')
    lines = block.splitlines()
    return '\n'.join(f"{indent}{line.strip()}" for line in lines)

def repl(match: re.Match) -> str:
    indent = match.group('indent')
    date = fmt(match.group('date'), indent + '  ')
    details = fmt(match.group('details'), indent + '    ')
    meta = fmt(match.group('meta'), indent + '    ')
    price_block = match.group('price')
    parts = [f"{indent}<div class=\"service-item\">", date, f"{indent}  <div class=\"service-inline\">", details]
    if price_block:
        price = fmt(price_block, indent + '    ')
        parts.append(price)
    parts.append(meta)
    parts.append(f"{indent}  </div>")
    parts.append(f"{indent}</div>")

if count == 0:
    raise SystemExit('No service items matched for reindent')
if not new_text.endswith('\n'):
    new_text += '\n'
```

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Planning manual reformatting approach**

I’m working through a detailed plan to manually reconstruct the entire service-history HTML block by scripting it from structured data to ensure consistent indentation and formatting, since automated formatting removed needed nested indents and created too much mess. This approach balances accuracy and maintainability, letting me produce a clean patch replacing the original block with properly formatted entries grouped by year, including repeated SVG icons and comments.</details></think>

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="bash" data-tool-name="run_terminal_cmd">
<details><summary>Tool use: **command** • Run command: cd /home/tech/projects/ppdb-ts-oct && python - <<'PY'
from pathlib import Path
path = Path('reference/redesign/mockui-service-history.html')
text = path.read_text()
start_marker = '        <!-- Service History -->'
start = text.find(start_marker)
if start == -1:
    raise SystemExit('Service history marker not found')
# find end of service-history div as before
start_div = text.find('<div class="service-history">', start)
if start_div == -1:
    raise SystemExit('service-history div not found')
idx = start_div
count = 0
end = None
while idx < len(text):
    if text.startswith('<div', idx):
        count += 1
        idx += 4
        continue
    if text.startswith('</div>', idx):
        count -= 1
        idx += 6
        if count == 0:
            end = idx
            break
        continue
    idx += 1
if end is None:
    raise SystemExit('Failed to find end of service-history div')
end_section = end
# include trailing newline after closing div (likely plus newline). We'll capture upto end_section.

comment_lines = [
    ('<!-- 2021 Services -->', [
        {'date': '10-09-2021', 'details': 'Full clip 3 legs 7 short ears & face leave top knot', 'price': '$60', 'tech': 'CC'},
        {'date': '25-05-2021', 'details': 'full clip 3 short ears and face', 'price': None, 'tech': 'bb'},
    ]),
    ('<!-- 2020 Services -->', [
        {'date': '08-12-2020', 'details': 'full clip 5 short ears and face', 'price': '$55', 'tech': 'BB'},
        {'date': '27-08-2020', 'details': 'full clip 3 short ears and face', 'price': None, 'tech': 'CC'},
        {'date': '10-03-2020', 'details': 'full clip 3 short ears and face', 'price': None, 'tech': 'hm'},
    ]),
    ('<!-- 2019 Services -->', [
        {'date': '08-11-2019', 'details': 'full clip 5 short ears and face', 'price': '$55', 'tech': 'bb'},
    ]),
    ('<!-- 2017 Services -->', [
        {'date': '18-12-2017', 'details': 'full clip 7 short ears and face cc.', 'price': None, 'tech': 'cc'},
        {'date': '11-05-2017', 'details': 'full clip 5 short ears and face', 'price': '$50', 'tech': 'cc'},
    ]),
    ('<!-- 2016 Services -->', [
        {'date': '13-10-2016', 'details': 'full clip 7 short ears and face', 'price': None, 'tech': 'th'},
        {'date': '08-03-2016', 'details': 'full clip 7 short ears and face', 'price': None, 'tech': 'cc'},
    ]),
    ('<!-- 2015 Services -->', [
        {'date': '14-11-2015', 'details': 'full clip 7 short ears and face', 'price': None, 'tech': 'cc'},
    ]),
]

date_icon = [
    '              <svg',
    '                fill="none"',
    '                stroke="currentColor"',
    '                viewBox="0 0 24 24"',
    '              >',
    '                <path',
    '                  stroke-linecap="round"',
    '                  stroke-linejoin="round"',
    '                  stroke-width="2"',
    '                  d="M8 7V3m8 4V3m-9 8h10M5 21h14a2 2 0 002-2V7a2 2 0 00-2-2H5a2 2 0 00-2 2v12a2 2 0 002 2z"',
    '                />',
    '              </svg>',
]

tech_icon = [
    '                  <svg',
    '                    fill="none"',
    '                    stroke="currentColor"',
    '                    viewBox="0 0 24 24"',
    '                  >',
    '                    <path',
    '                      stroke-linecap="round"',
    '                      stroke-linejoin="round"',
    '                      stroke-width="2"',
    '                      d="M16 7a4 4 0 11-8 0 4 4 0 018 0zM12 14a7 7 0 00-7 7h14a7 7 0 00-7-7z"',
    '                    />',
    '                  </svg>',
]

lines = ['        <!-- Service History -->', '        <div class="service-history">']
for comment, entries in comment_lines:
    lines.append(f'          {comment}')
    for entry in entries:
        lines.append('          <div class="service-item">')
        lines.append('            <div class="service-date">')
        lines.extend(date_icon)
        lines.append(f'              {entry["date"]}')
        lines.append('            </div>')
        lines.append('            <div class="service-inline">')
        lines.append('              <div class="service-details">')
        lines.append(f'                {entry["details"]}')
        lines.append('              </div>')
        if entry['price']:
            lines.append(f'              <div class="service-price">{entry["price"]}</div>')
        lines.append('              <div class="service-meta">')
        lines.append('                <span class="service-tech">')
        lines.extend(tech_icon)
        lines.append(f'                  {entry["tech"]}')
        lines.append('                </span>')
        lines.append('              </div>')
        lines.append('            </div>')
        lines.append('          </div>')
lines.append('        </div>')
new_block = '\n'.join(lines)
if not new_block.endswith('\n'):
    new_block += '\n'
text = text[:start] + new_block + text[end_section:]
path.write_text(text)
print('Rebuilt service history block with compact layout')
PY</summary>

```bash
    '                      stroke-linejoin="round"',
    '                      stroke-width="2"',
    '                      d="M16 7a4 4 0 11-8 0 4 4 0 018 0zM12 14a7 7 0 00-7 7h14a7 7 0 00-7-7z"',
    '                    />',
    '                  </svg>',
]

lines = ['        <!-- Service History -->', '        <div class="service-history">']
for comment, entries in comment_lines:
    lines.append(f'          {comment}')
    for entry in entries:
        lines.append('          <div class="service-item">')
        lines.append('            <div class="service-date">')
        lines.extend(date_icon)
        lines.append(f'              {entry["date"]}')
        lines.append('            </div>')
        lines.append('            <div class="service-inline">')
        lines.append('              <div class="service-details">')
        lines.append(f'                {entry["details"]}')
        lines.append('              </div>')
        if entry['price']:
            lines.append(f'              <div class="service-price">{entry["price"]}</div>')
        lines.append('              <div class="service-meta">')
        lines.append('                <span class="service-tech">')
        lines.extend(tech_icon)
        lines.append(f'                  {entry["tech"]}')
        lines.append('                </span>')
        lines.append('              </div>')
        lines.append('            </div>')
        lines.append('          </div>')
lines.append('        </div>')
new_block = '\n'.join(lines)
if not new_block.endswith('\n'):
    new_block += '\n'
text = text[:start] + new_block + text[end_section:]
path.write_text(text)
print('Rebuilt service history block with compact layout')
PY
```

now correctly scores 225 (both exact matches + bonus) vs 100 (only one match)\n  - Created comprehensive documentation in &#96;SCORES.md&#96; with 12+ Mermaid diagrams and detailed examples\n  - Fixed issue where partial matches were incorrectly scored against full multi-word query\n  - Documentation updated to v2.0 with all ASCII diagrams converted to interactive Mermaid visualizations\n\n- **Unified Customer Search**: Comprehensive multi-field search functionality\n  - **API Enhancement** (&#96;src/app/api/animals/route.ts&#96;): Implemented unified search with relevance scoring\n    - Single &#96;q&#96; query parameter replaces separate &#96;search&#96;, &#96;breed&#96;, and &#96;surname&#96; parameters\n    - Searches across 8 fields: customer surname, firstname, email, phone1, phone2, phone3, animal name, and breed name\n    - Phone number normalization (strips spaces, dashes, parentheses) for better matching\n    - Multi-term query support (e.g., \&quot;bobby maltese\&quot; searches both name and breed)\n    - Relevance scoring algorithm with weighted matches:\n      - Exact match: 100 points\n      - Starts with: 80 points\n      - Contains: 50 points\n      - Fuzzy match: 30 points (70% character overlap)\n      - Multi-field bonus: +20 points for matching multiple terms\n    - Results sorted by relevance score (descending), then by customer surname\n  - **Validation Schema** (&#96;src/lib/validations/animal.ts&#96;): Simplified to single query parameter\n    - Changed from &#96;search&#96;, &#96;breed&#96;, &#96;surname&#96; to store NULL instead of empty string when colour is not provided\n  - Aligns with \&quot;drop-in replacement philosophy\&quot; - handles dirty data in application layer without database modifications\n  - Application now properly handles nullable colour values in all API responses and UI components\n  - Regenerated Prisma client to update TypeScript types\n\n- **Phone Number Search**: Fixed phone number matching to normalize both query and database values\n  - Phone fields now strip spaces, dashes, and parentheses before comparison\n  - Searching \&quot;1234567\&quot; now correctly scores 225 (both exact matches + bonus) vs 100 (only one match)\n  - Created comprehensive documentation in &#96;SCORES.md&#96; with 12+ Mermaid diagrams and detailed examples\n  - Fixed issue where partial matches were incorrectly scored against full multi-word query\n  - Documentation updated to v2.0 with all ASCII diagrams converted to interactive Mermaid visualizations\n\n- **Unified Customer Search**: Comprehensive multi-field search functionality\n  - **API Enhancement** (&#96;src/app/api/animals/route.ts&#96;): Implemented unified search with relevance scoring\n    - Single &#96;q&#96; query parameter replaces separate &#96;search&#96;, &#96;breed&#96;, and &#96;surname&#96; parameters\n    - Searches across 8 fields: customer surname, firstname, email, phone1, phone2, phone3, animal name, and breed name\n    - Phone number normalization (strips spaces, dashes, parentheses) for better matching\n    - Multi-term query support (e.g., \&quot;bobby maltese\&quot; searches both name and breed)\n    - Relevance scoring algorithm with weighted matches:\n      - Exact match: 100 points\n      - Starts with: 80 points\n      - Contains: 50 points\n      - Fuzzy match: 30 points (70% character overlap)\n      - Multi-field bonus: +20 points for matching multiple terms\n    - Results sorted by relevance score (descending), then by customer surname\n  - **Validation Schema** (&#96;src/lib/validations/animal.ts&#96;): Simplified to single query parameter\n    - Changed from &#96;search&#96;, &#96;breed&#96;, &#96;surname&#96; ## Summary
- Reworked the service history styles so each card uses a flex column with a dedicated inline row, allowing the details, price, and technician pill to share a single horizontal track and cutting vertical whitespace while preserving existing hover/focus affordances.  
```537:622:reference/redesign/mockui-service-history.html
      .service-history {
        display: flex;
        flex-direction: column;
        gap: var(--space-4);
      }

      .service-item {
        background: white;
        border: 1px solid var(--gray-200);
        border-radius: var(--radius-xl);
        padding: var(--space-4) var(--space-5);
        border-left: 4px solid var(--primary);
        transition: all var(--duration-slow) var(--ease-bounce);
        opacity: 0;
        animation: slideInUp 0.4s var(--ease-out) forwards;
        box-shadow: var(--shadow-sm);
        display: flex;
        flex-direction: column;
        gap: var(--space-3);
      }

        display: flex;
        align-items: flex-start;
        gap: var(--space-4);
        flex-wrap: wrap;
      }

        flex-shrink: 0;
      }

        display: flex;
        align-items: center;

        margin-top: 0;
        flex-wrap: wrap;
      }
```
- Regenerated every service note entry so the date header stands alone and the rest of the content (note text, optional price, technician badge) lives inside the new `.service-inline` row, matching the requested compact display throughout the 2015‑2021 data set.

- Logged the abandoned regex-based restructuring attempt in the new `FAILURELOG.md`, and recorded the successful layout change in both `CHANGELOG.md` and `FILETREE.md` so future contributors have traceability.  
```1:8:FAILURELOG.md
# FAILURE LOG

## 2025-11-15 - Service history layout refactor

- **Attempt**: Used a Python regex script to rewrite each `.service-item` block inline by moving the date, price, and technician markup without recreating the surrounding HTML structure.
- **Issue**: The script retained original indentation inside the newly inserted containers, producing double-spaced markup with inconsistent whitespace and readability issues that violated the compact layout requirement.
- **Resolution**: Rebuilt the entire `service-history` section from structured data so every entry shares a consistent template and formatting, then re-ran the layout with the updated CSS flex styles.
- **Prevention**: When large structural shifts are needed, generate clean markup from templates (or dedent blocks before reinsertion) instead of manipulating raw strings with regex.
```

## Testing
- Not run (static HTML/CSS updates only). Please open `reference/redesign/mockui-service-history.html` in a browser to confirm the tighter vertical rhythm looks right in context.

## Next Steps
- If this compact pattern feels good, mirror the same horizontal treatment in any related mock UIs (customer history, breed logs) for consistency.
- Consider animating the inline row (e.g., subtle fade) if you need extra visual separation once real data is wired up.

User decision: **accepted**

---

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Refactoring service history layout and styles**

I'm reworking the service history section by removing the focus-within outline and adjusting gaps to zero since the border now provides separation. I’m introducing a new `.history-card` with distinct header and body areas to wrap stats and history entries, updating CSS accordingly to add shadows, radii, and backgrounds. The HTML will be restructured to nest `stats-grid` inside the header and service entries inside the body, keeping a clean minimal header without extra titles unless the user wants later. This should create a clearer, more modern presentation for the service history area.</details></think>

&#39;0000-00-00&#39; dates to NULL\n  - Converts tables to InnoDB with utf8mb4 character set\n  - Updates all ID columns to INT UNSIGNED\n  - Renames columns for clarity (SEX→sex, without breed/customer, notes without animal)\n  - Identifies duplicate breed names that would violate unique constraint\n  - Counts sentinel dates to be cleaned\n  - Checks data that might be truncated\n  - Reports current table engines, character sets, and indexes\n  - Estimates table sizes for downtime calculation\n- **prisma/scripts/post-migration-validation.sql**: 14 comprehensive Validates sentinel dates cleaned (now NULL)\n  - Checks for data truncation issues\n  - Samples data to verify integrity\n\n**Utility Scripts:**\n\n- **prisma/scripts/rollback.sql**: Emergency rollback script (restoring from backup strongly preferred)\n  - Reverts column renames\n  - Removes foreign keys and new indexes\n  - Changes column types back to original\n  - Optionally converts back to MyISAM and latin1 (not recommended)\n- **prisma/scripts/QUICK_REFERENCE.md**: One-page quick reference with commands, timeline, code changes, and common issues\n\n### Testing Improvements\n\n- ## Summary
- Wrapped the stats overview and note stream inside a single glassmorphic `history-card`, so the gradient header acts as the “cover” and the entries read as one continuous timeline with dividers instead of isolated tiles.  
```1017:1089:reference/redesign/mockui-service-history.html
            <div class="history-card">
                <div class="history-header">
                    <div class="stats-grid">
                        <div class="stat-item">
                            <span class="stat-number">11</span>
                            <span class="stat-label">Total Services</span>
                        </div>
                        ...
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="history-body">
                    <!-- Service History -->
                    <div class="service-history">
                        <!-- 2021 Services -->
                        <div class="service-item">
                            <div class="service-date">
                                <svg fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24">
                                    <path ... />
                                </svg>
                                10-09-2021
                            </div>
                            <div class="service-inline">
                                <div class="service-details">
                                    Full clip 3 legs 7 short ears & face leave top knot
                                </div>
                                <div class="service-price">$60</div>
                                <div class="service-meta">
                                    <span class="service-tech">...</span>
                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                        ...
```
- Updated the service-history styles so the list has zero gap, each `.service-item` uses shared padding, and adjacent rows get a subtle top border—yielding the requested horizontal separators without extra cards.  
```559:637:reference/redesign/mockui-service-history.html
      .service-history {
        display: flex;
        flex-direction: column;
        gap: 0;
      }

      .service-item {
        padding: var(--space-4) 0;
        transition: transform var(--duration-slow) var(--ease-bounce);
        opacity: 0;
        animation: slideInUp 0.4s var(--ease-out) forwards;
        display: flex;
        flex-direction: column;
        gap: var(--space-3);
      }

      .service-item + .service-item {
        border-top: 1px solid var(--gray-200);
      }
...

            border-radius: var(--radius-2xl);

            background: white;
        }
```
- Documented the redesign in `CHANGELOG.md` and refined the `FILETREE.md` description so teammates know this mock now uses a unified stats header with divider-separated notes.
